intro: Serapias polyaden, commonly known as the woolly rock orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, and often pale green or yellowish leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow or orange flowers with prominent, fleshy lips, which are adapted for specific pollination mechanisms. It thrives in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in open habitats such as cliffs and slopes. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in many areas.
